revised_title: Advances in Determining the Earth's Gravity Field Using Satellite Doppler Tracking
tldr: This article discusses the advancements in determining the Earth's gravity field using satellite Doppler tracking. It outlines the methods and techniques used, such as optical, laser, and Doppler observations, and evaluates the accuracy of recent geopotential models, including the Goddard Earth Models. The article also compares the geoid maps derived from these models and assesses their accuracy, highlighting the importance of satellite altimetry data in improving the accuracy of future models.
